episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky and fascinating topics, including a world record for flipping beer mats, the concept of 'Panda Harvard' for training pandas to survive in the wild, the story of the American flag's design by a student, and the origins of water skiing by a man who started on a wooden chair.

facts.fact: The world record for most beer mats flipped and caught in one hand is held by a man called Matt Hand.
The American flag was designed by a 17-year-old student, and his teacher gave him a B minus for it.
The inventor of water skiing started out being pulled along behind a boat standing on his head on a wooden chair.
